comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: Maybe the New York City public health advocate Dr. Stephen Smith (1823-1922)? en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stephen_Smith_(surgeon)

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: Yes -- here is Dr. Smith in 1863-64, as a young faculty member of the Bellevue Hospital Medical College, City of New York, with the same scowl and beetle brows, and the same eagle-ish glint in the eye: www.braceface.com/medical/images/Jefferson_faculty_Smith0... He was a founder of the American Public Health Association, in 1872. Here is a NYT story, February 20, 1913, about Dr. Smith's 90th birthday party: query.nytimes.com/mem/archive-free/pdf?_r=1&res=9D00E... Perhaps something happened to him in December of that year, which would be the occasion for the Bain News Service to circulate a photo of him dated January 1, 1914?

comment.author: 34904489@N07
comment._content:
pennylrichardsca and Wystan,

Thanks for the information on Dr. Smith. I particularly enjoyed the photo of him as a young man - quite a recognizable face!  We will add to the record when we update.
